docs.snippet: So we are not to have the streets cleaned after all. Mr. SMITH, the man of machines, retires from the unequal contest. The City Inspector hired him to do the work,-Mayor WOOD promised to countersign his warrants, if the work was well done, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: So we are not to have the streets cleaned after all. Mr. SMITH, the man of machines, retires from the unequal contest. The City Inspector hired him to do the work,-Mayor WOOD promised to countersign his warrants, if the work was well done, and Comptroller HAWS promised to pay him the money on the same

docs.snippet: In the State Senate the New-York Tax Levy was referred to the New-York Senators. Mr. MANIERRE introduced a bill to oblige the Superintendent of the Banking Department, in certain contingencies, to give the printing of notes to others than the...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the State Senate the New-York Tax Levy was referred to the New-York Senators. Mr. MANIERRE introduced a bill to oblige the Superintendent of the Banking Department, in certain contingencies, to give the printing of notes to others than the American Bank Note Company. The bill authorizing the sale of the West Washington Market property to the City was passed.

docs.snippet: The proverb tells us that it is a "long lane which has no turning;" and the Legislature at Albany are now considering, with all the symptoms of speedy and favorable action, the one remedy to which we have long been looking forward for the enormous...
docs.lead_paragraph: The proverb tells us that it is a "long lane which has no turning;" and the Legislature at Albany are now considering, with all the symptoms of speedy and favorable action, the one remedy to which we have long been looking forward for the enormous abuses of the railway system in this City.

headline.main: THE AFRICAN SLAVE-TRADE.; Startling and Important Developments. Alarming Increase and Rapid Growth of the Slave Traffic--Necessity for Measures of Repression.

byline.original: Special Dispatch to the New-York Times

docs.snippet: THE TROUBLES IN TEXAS.  Gov. HOUSTON'S dispatches, which were expected by the Senate to-day, but not sent in, give thrilling but painful accounts of well-authenticated outrages upon families along the Rio Grande.

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; The Senate Preparing for a War with Mexico. Speech of Mr. Ashmore, of South Carolina, in the House. THE MEXICAN TREATY. THE SALE OF FEDERAL ARMS. ENLARGEMENT OF THE CAPITOL GROUNDS. THE PRINTERSHIP QUESTION. MISCELLANEOUS ITEMS. SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; COMPTROLLER'S OFFICE. BOARD OF ALDERMEN. ALDERMEN'S COMMITTEES. CONTESTED SEATS--NO QUORUM. POLICE REPORTS. A MALICIOUS BURGLAR. AN ABSCONDING STAKEHOLDER. LOVERS OF COFFEE. ALTOGETHER TOO OFFICIOUS. A SPECIOUS IMPOSTOR. UNSUCCESSFUL THIEVES. SUSPECTED BURGLARS. THE PEARL-STREET BURGLARS. BEATEN ALMOST TO DEATH.

docs.lead_paragraph: DOCKS, PIERS AND SLIPS LEASED AT AUCTION. The Comptroller at 12 M. yesterday sold at pub lic auction the right to collect and retain the wharfage for the use or occupation of the undermentioned docks, piers and slips, for the term of five years from May 1 next.

headline.main: Further Details of Interest--American Vessels on the Coast--Naval Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since my last, occurrences of interest have transpired in this part of the world. So much of interest has transpired in the Slave-trading world that your correspondent finds himself unable to give in a news-letter little more than a mere outline of the mass of news which has been accumulating.

headline.main: NEWS FROM EUROPE.; Arrival of the Edinburgh and Anglo-Saxon.STATE ON THE ITALIAN QUESTION.How Mr. Gladstone's Budget was Received.LATER FROM MOROCCO.Journals Supressed in France. THE ITALIAN QUESTION. REPLY TO THE POPE'S ENCYCLICAL LETTER. LETTER FROM POPE PIUS. GREAT BRITAIN. THE SENSE OF THE PRESS. LORD BROUGHAM AND MR. GLADSTONE. MISCELLANEOUS NEWS. FRANCE. ITALY. NEWS FROM EUROPE. SPAIN AND MOROCCO. DENMARK. AUSTRIA. CHINA. The Very Latest via-Queenstown. Commercial News by the Edinburgh. LONDON MONEY MARKET.

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw-steamship Edinburgh, Capt. KENNEDY, which sailed from Liverpool at 1 P.M. on the 15th February, and from Queenstown on the following day, arrived at the Southwest Spit early in the afternoon of yesterday. She was obliged to anchor in the Lower Bay, in consequence of the fog.

headline.main: Impostors--Bogus Charities.; Clean Streets. NEW-YORK, Wednesday, Feb. 29, 1860.
